page.title: 03CHICHESTER-HOSPITALS
page.content: The {Chichester }group of hospitals consists of {The St.Richard's and The {Broyle Road}branches of{The Royal West {Sussex Hospital and Graylingwell {Hospital.}Records show that provision for the care of the sick & infirm in Chichester goes back at least to the 13th century.A public dispensary began in 1784 on the site of the present Broyle Road branch and Thomas Bridger was the first patient. The present building dates from 1826 with later additions. In 1826 the matron received a wisteria plant from China. It is now the largest and oldest in the country and adorns the facade of the hospital. St.Richards opened it 1939 and has developed with additions to be an accident and emergency hospital. Graylingwell opened in 1897 as the hospital for mental illness in West Sussex & now has day care facilities.
